review: Last night me and my wife stopped in to spend a gift card from Christmas.  The dining area was quite busy, so we ate at the Bar.  The very helpful bartender recomended to us their 2 for $35.00.  The meal includes two premium margaritas, appetizer, two main entree meals and dessert.  Great value, great food and good atmosphere.  Oh yeah, the Margaritas had the right amount of kick to them, not just sweet syrup.  The bartender was very nice and she was very helpful.  We will return again before the 2 for $35.00 disappears.

I'd never had Chili's before two years ago on a first date and now it's our fav place to keep coming back to! The margaritas are awesome, top shelf only of course. Texas fries and spinach artichoke dip are good appetizers. I always get the Cajun pasta with chicken minus the Cajun spices (lol I prefer food to not be spicy). My boyfriend always gets the steak blackened and it's always good. Never tried their dessert before so can't comment on that! always nice workers! their cup of chili is delish too i might add
Okay food. Saw an amazing argument between a chick and a dude. That made me give it one more star

Done giving this place 2nd, 3rd, and more chances. You can do better then this place unless you enjoy sub-standard service, cold food, and watered down drinks. As for us?  We're done with this poor excuse of a restaurant.
No thanks!  Loved Chili's in other cities. Not this one. It's dirty, food wasnt served hot, seemed like the food was old... I don't recommend.

My wife and I would consider ourselves 7 year regulars here (once or maybe twice a month)......this place is not about 5 star food although we would not be regulars if we didn't enjoy it. Its about the service, this staff has a low turn over and make it a point to remember you as a customer and always show the appreciation for another return. Not sure what these other comments are about but I've NEVER received anything less than an ice cold beer and pretty good food.

This place must be under new management since their first opening.  Service is slow, the place looks dirty.  In afraid to go back and see what the kitchen looks like if they leave tables full of dishes.

It's a chain but it feels like it's run with extra-special care and attention.  Not once out of the 5 times I've eaten here, do I sense a fall off in the food preparation quality.  I've always felt the eatery is run by really helpful and friendly staff.  It's a reflection of the management philosophy there.  Steak is prepared better here than at many other similarly sized chain family restaurants.  It's no coincidence why this place is usually crowded.

Not certain why I did it to myself, maybe I was thinking that maybe Chilis had made some changes and improved services and quality of food but I was WRONG!!!! I have tried 3 different Chilis and all 3 have left me disappointed. Service was impersonal and once I placed my order it took a long time to receive my order. I ordered steak fajitas and disappointed with the taste and quantity. For the same price at another local restaurant not only did I get flour tortillas, veggies and steak strips but I also was served rice, beans, pic de gallo, guacamole. WAY more food!!!!!! I plan for leftovers for my lunches. Giving up on Chilis!
Kaleb made it a great experience.... My family and I have been here before and weren't happy but he was remarkable! Thank you!

In fairness, we were waiting for a friend, but gave up after ten minutes. Still, our server was inattentive and unconcerned about anything. The place wasn't busy at all! Finally, he checked on us, after about five minutes of us trying to get any other staff member's attention! The good was okay... I got the quesadilla explosion salad; the quesadilla was rubbery and bland, almost like it had been microwaved or sitting out for hours! My advice: if you really want Chili's, go to the Tulare location. Much better food and service.

3rd visit here, and shame on us for coming back. Our waiter Efrin was on top of things, but once again the food was very disappointing. Their full rack of baby back ribs is 10 ribs, never seen a rack that small. They ribs were dry with not much flavor to them. My wife had the fajita trio, flavorless also. Corn tortillas were overheated and hard, which made them tough to bite through. The condiments that came with the fajitas weren't even enough to make the three tacos with the tortillas provided. The deserts were the highlight of the meal. Won't ever go back again due to the food even though the hostess & our waiter were on top of their game.

Wow, don't order the mango chile chicken! The rice had zero flavor, the steamed broccoli was like a salt lick and the chicken was a cacophony of ingredients thrown together that didn't belong. I have eaten at this Chili's for years and this is by far the worst dish I've ever had here.

Our food took forever and it wasn't busy. 8 pm. Our server only gave us refills when we asked. At one point, we placed our empty glasses at the end of the table and we still had to ask. Took forever getting our check. I am still waiting at the table with out foods boxed waiting on a check. Bathrooms are gross. No toilet paper in two stalls. The bathrooms are located at the very corner with almost no signs pointing you to the bathrooms. I walked by the cooking area and it was messy and water all over the floor. Nobody was cleaning the mess. Bottom line- worst Applebee's ever!!!!

I went to Chili's and the service was horrible.  The majority of the cups was dirty. The waitress was rude. The establishment was fairly empty inside at the moment also. I don't understand what was taking so long. I was never checked on throughout my stay to see if I needed refills. I ordered a soup and I was the last person to receive my meal. We waited about 30 mins for our good on a weekend for a half full establishment. I watched tables who came after my party with more people receive their food before me. Unacceptable.

Awesome service. I've been to a number of restaurants within this chain and this one exceeds my expectations with service and the efficiency of the restaurant as a whole. Not real busy but my waitress was extremely attentive.  Awesome experience

My food was delicious! Beer very cold. The reason I gave this place 3 stars is because happy hour is only at the bar...Boo Boo Boo! When I received my awesome grilled 420 calorie salad I didnt receive any dressing. Had to wait about 3 or 4 min for the waiter to return,  and had to wait another min for him to return with the dressing. I would def come back for the food again..oh yeah and it took about 25 min to get our food..

Horrible service. Bland food. Taste like it was just microwaved before being brought out to you, server rude and seemed like she hates her job. There was a few people in the resteraunt so don't understand what the lag was. Never coming back.

Jamie was one of the most amazing waitresses I've ever had. So sweet and had great customer service. I usually am not a huge fan of Chili's, but this visit was exceptional. The food was good and came out in a timely manner, especially for how busy they were. My grandfather wanted hot cocoa, but they didn't sell it. So what did Jamie do? She had someone go out and get him hot cocoa! Amazing service. Can't believe how accommodating Jamie was tonight.

Been to this restaurant a couple of times with no problems. Today I brought the family and it was a horrible experience. We were seated at our table at 7:10. at 7:36 I had to get a bus boy to get the manager for me as the server had not come by to get our order.

Omg!! This place went from a 6 to a 10!!! Best black bean burger ever  Wether you're a vegetarian or not it's a must have!!! Service was awesome, even though it was 11pm Adam made us feel right at home...thank you Adam!!

This location is usually superb~ but tonite the place was packed and we ended up with the worst server. Things started out promising.  Party of two walks in and is seated almost immediately.  Drink orders were also taken promptly.  That's where our luck ran out. We sat quietly for about 40 minutes after our order was taken.  Caught a couple of glimpses of our server as she raced around the restaurant. Our drinks were dry... & the table of 2 across from us, who arrived after us had their sizzling fajitas delivered.   I had ordered soup & salad and had nothing to show!  I told my hubby "lets get outta here."  & out we strolled...

Absolute worst service, waitress and bartender stood chatting while customers were not greeted and ignored at tables only checking on them when seemingly convienent. Extremely discouraged from ever returning.

This time at Chili's was not good.  Food was barely warm, cold would be closer.  Then the dishes came out in waves.  Seven people, came out 2 at a time.  Then finally the last one came.  The manager came over.  Brought hot fries.  The main dish was cold, but it would take 15 minutes for a new one.  No price adjustment.  Very sad experience. Wish I had gone some place else.

I cant even give any stars to this place had Crappy Service from the Bartender Who Served us our food with an attitude... took another server to go do the bartenders Job... The Manager wasnt even Helpful at all... She was stuck up just like the Bartender.. Where do you get Your Customer Service Training at? And if you Hate Your Job then You Should Be In A Different Career and not working around People Everyday...

Where do I begin? We waited for one hour and 20 minutes to be seated. Somewhat expectable for a Saturday with 6 people. The waiter was pretty good. Quick and professional. However when he brought the iron skillet he set it by the 2 year old at our table and when her Mom moved it to protect the child she burnt her hand. The only consolation from the waiter was "yeah, it's hot". Then the "medium well" steak we ordered was "well". We returned it and got a second. It was rare. Seriously red rare. Another problem was the margarita chicken. It's a piece of chicken on top of black beans with a sprinkle of rice. Overall I wish I could start over and eat somewhere else.

If I can give negative stars I would. First off, we were seated promptly which was great because it didn't seem to be busy. Our waitress "Kelly" took our drink order and our food order. When we got our drinks she only gave us 4 straws and there was 5 of us. 1 set of silverware when got our appetizers. Almost 1 hour later we finally got our food but I was cold. Said they got really busy but I only seen 3 people come in after us and the couple next to us got there food in less than 10 minutes while we continued to wait for ours . I thought fajitas was suppose to sizzle when they brought them to the table. These were clearly not even warm. The quesadilla  had almost a block of cheese and they didn't even put ranch in it. It was discussting! Again we waited while she went and got more ranch and they burger was so dry. When we got our check  we still had food on the table and she didn't even bother to ask if we needed to go boxes.  We got up and got them ourselves. Horrible worthless waitress. And as I was paying on this stupid device on the table,  she was kind of hovering over me while I put $0.00 tip for her horrible service and as I was taking the survey, she made a face as if she was annoyed.  If anything we should be the ones annoyed for not receiving good service. Plus she seemed like she was on a Crack trip. And this whole "table entertainment " charge just to pay at the table is BS! they charged $.99 to use this service . And by the way, the restrooms were so discussting they smelled like a fish market. I won't be returning until they completely overhaul this dump of a restaurant!

Won't be back. Gave this location several chances and each time we left regretting why we went. This time was the final straw. 20 mins to get greeted, 20 to get our drinks, an additional 15 mins to get my husband's drink because the tap blew and no one knew how to change the keg!!! This was the conversation we heard from the servers and the bartender!!! 20 mins to be asked if we were ordering dinner after that point ans 30 mins to offer up the check. Never saw a mgr, our apps came without utensils. The handheld at the table was out of receipt paper so I never got a reciept...which at this point was the least of our concern. I understand that they could have been short staffed....but where was the manager? Why did not a single employee have a sense of urgency? It was a holiday weekend...I would have spoken to the mgr had there been one around so it's social media and their corporate email that gets to hear my rant.

My husband and I came for a meal.and were impressed. I have a Wheat allergy This means I cannot have wheat or anything with wheat in it, not only am I allergic to wheat, but I am also allergic to Soy. This makes for an interesting eating out experience, which usually means I get rabbit food. Jerry the manager was awesome, he accommodated my allergy just fine and dinner is YUMMMMY. Will be back

Sad to say this place isn't what it used to be. It took forever for someone to take our drink orders and it wasn't even that busy. Then when we got our utensils they were dirty. There was still food stuck on the knifes. It was really gross. I had water and it tasted like they got it out of a fish tank..... Seriously disappointed in this place cuz it used to be my favorite spot...
Good was good but our server Efrain worst service. Left him $1.02 tip. He is lucky to have gotten that.

This is so far the worst experience I have had at an chili's outlet. It took them forever to get us a table and once we were walked to our table, the silver ware and plates provide were only for 3 people and we were a group of 6. The plates and silverware were taken fresh out of dishwasher and were still dripping with water. When the time came to order our appetizer they mixed up our order. And this was just the beginning of  a night that I wish I never wasted on chili's. Our drinks were mixed up, our food was mixed up. I have never been this disappointed with chili's. Given an option I would not recommend this outlet to anyone.

Woah! This place needs an update. Looks at the terrible recent reviews! I like to treat my reviews as a working document. "Blah blah blah," my wife says We were promptly seated and had our beverages within 10 minutes.  We ordered within 12 and had our apps by 16 minutes. Service seemed fine! Which was odd because that seemed to be the largest complaint I've read about.  Our food came out with plenty of time and it looked great, it smelled great. My wife ordered the margarita chicken salad and I ordered the fajita trio with chicken, shrimp and prime rib. My wife loved her salad. It was seasoned very well. I really liked the fajitas, but they needed the sides for flavor. The prime rib, alone, was bland and had little taste. The shrimp was fairly good, but the chicken was cooked excellently.  Service began to dwindle as our evening went on. (We didn't stay a long time.) After our waitress came by and refilled our drinks, just after she gave us our food, we didn't see her again. No biggie, since they have the "ziosk."  Side note: lots of employees here don't look like employees. Random blank black Tshirt and dark jeans on one guy and a striped polo with dockers on another guy. I had no idea if people were employees or secret workers?!?  Bottom line: Did we have a 5 star evening? No.  Service was a 3.5/5 Food was 3.5/5 Cleanliness was 4/5 Overall 3.75/5

We ordered 4 meals online.  The website said that the orders (2 black bean burgers and 2 fajitas; and one of these had a side of rice and beans) would be ready for pickup at 6:42. It finally came oit at 6:55, no apologies. There was only one person ahead of us. Get back to the house, we find that they didn't include the rice/beans. And the steaks for the fajitas so stringy I couldn't finish it.

We come in alot and the last few times we have been very disapointed. First off their menus are ALWAYS STICKY with food and who knows what else. Their tables are still dirty and sticky as well. Benches always full of crumbs.  Food is usually good and so are the drinks

Hands down the worst steaks we have ever had. We both asked for medium rare, and both were cooked beyond well done. To top it off, mine was SMOTHERED in a spicy diarrhea sauce. So gross... :( Our server was nice, though.
Worst place to eat. Service was bad. Took more than 1 hour to serve our food!!! Never going back to this restaurant!!!!!

Avoid this place like the plague.  For years we have been regulars, spending hundreds of hard earned dollars at this establishment and it was great for a long long time that is until recently when service and standards have taken a serious nose dive.  I have written this review at least 5 times and decided to give them another chance but after this last trip I decided enough is enough.   You might get a decent meal here but it's very hit and miss now days.  We had been regulars for a long while and had grown to know a bunch of the staff,  then suddenly the staff changed almost overnight and everything has been downhill from there.
Far below average. The food is very mediocre and the wait is beyond what you can even imagine.  I don't recommend this place at all.

We always liked this place but, today it was the worse service by waitress and kitchen staff. First off the waitress didn't know her stuff saying the new steak didn't come with side of fries when the website says it does. Then they gave my wife's plate away to another table so she had to wait till they made it all over again. My steak was Burnt, my wife's side of the southwestern Mac and cheese didn't have everything on it. All steak orders he had were missing the butter on top 3 orders of fries. We order soup to be brought out before food we never got it. Service was slow. Sister in law ordered the steak with shrimp and she only got one shrimp  on it. Texas fries order only had like one or two jalapeños my niece had to ask for a side of them. So it was very wack #shittychilis

Chilis used to be a once-a-week stop for my husband and I.   About 3 months ago things went dramatically downhill.  Service became mediocre and the food itself pretty much is NEVER prepared properly. The visit prior to our LAST visit my husband and I went for our weekly "fix".   Our dinner was brought to us and my "medium" steak was very rare.  Waiter came to check on us 5-6 minutes after dropping off our food.  Told him about my steak. He took it back to the kitchen.  It came back to me 15 minutes later and was still raw.  My husband was done eating and I no longer was hungry.  Left very disappointed.   Not sure I wanted to go back.  3 weeks later we caved in and went back. Same thing with the steak.  Rare. Took back to the kitchen and 20 minutes later it was returned to me.  Cooked into oblivion. The "manager" who brought it must have been out sick when customer service skills were taught.  When I told him I could not eat that dried out over coked steak he simply picked it up and walked off.  Not a word was spoken to me. He never apologized.  Never said a thing. Since the rest of my dinner party was done eating I did not "want to order something else".  Left hungry for the second time in a row.   This is all so very disappointing.  Chilis was always our go-to place.  We liked that they were always consistent.  I really don't care if I ever go back there.

If I could give a 0 star rating I would. Our waitress Jackie was HORRIBLE. three beers and an appetizer took her almost 2 hours. I had a water and was never offered a refill during those 2 hours. I will NEVER come back again. Horrible horrible horrible. Please y'all find a new restaurant to enjoy with faster service and more attentive servers.

If I could this place ZERO stars I would. Took the family for lunch. We ordered drinks and got our menus. There was a staple sticking straight up in the middle of menu which I didn't expect and it stuck my index finger as I opened the menu. It hurt like hell. Our waiter shows up, talking at about one hundred miles an hour, the only male waiter. We placed our order, I told him what had happened and asked him not to hand out that menu because I had spilled blood on it from getting stuck with the staple. That inconsiderate jackass says "Oh, ok. Anything else for your order." We said no. And he walked off. I watched this ass place all the menus back into the hostess desk. There was biohazard fluid on that menu and he didn't give a rats ass about that or didn't even offer a bandaid. Next thing that went through my head was if someone else had been stuck with that same staple before me!!!! Dude provided HORRIBLE SERVICE and a disservice to the public in general. He can keep his skinny jeans, fashionable scar on his head and horrible attitude cause we ain't never going back to that place. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS ESTABLISHMENT!!!! Wholeheartedly.

What has happened to the great customer service people use to provide. Have been in for lunch the last few times and been waited on by the same miserable looking server with short dark hair. She has the worst attitude and negative vibe that makes you never want to return. If your job is that bad quit! Chili's get it together these reviews are all telling you that your employees give crappy service.

Waited 15min to be noticed. All I wanted was a beverage and some appetizers. After 20mins went to the restroom to get a drink of water and then went across the street to Applebee's. Thanks chili's! You did me a huge favor!!!

I have been to several Chillies while traveling.  This one is poorly run.  We waited an hour for our food, the food was OK.  The restaurant was not real busy but when we finally got out of there it had been over 2 hrs. Will not be back. Melissa
It was OK  The server seems  kind new and scared  Idk why  Then the  restaurant  was a disaster  Tamales were  a mess  And the floor was disgusting  The food is the food not good not bad

Horrible service. Put in a to go order on line and having to wait. Can't even get bartender attention long enough to pay for my orders so that when they are ready I can get going. It's been I'll be right with you, I'll be right back or just a minute What's the point of placing order in an advance.  Now late back to work It's been a long time since been here and now I know why and why not interested in coming back
Tera was awesome!! Great service great food tons of fun!!! Sirloin was amazing first time I've had it!

Service is inexcusably VERY slow. All the food that was ordered came out cold, which is a shame, because we ordered steaks and ribs. Our food took more than 40 mins. to come out. I don't mind if it comes out late, as long as the food is still hot, but it was obvious that the food sat on the counter for a long time. The table wasn't completely ready too when we were seated. Do not bring out-of-towners here. It'll just be embarrassing.

Well I was leaving the target parking lot n was discussing where to eat. Me and my family were really hungry n seen a chili's on the right side so we decided to give it a try. I didn't even know there was a chili's there n town. I'm very disappointed to have to say that the service was poor along with the flavors of the food. The flavors were of microwave shrimp it was squishy n not cooked well enough. The flavors did not go.  My niece's toast was burnt. I think we could of chipped a tooth n yes I'm over exaggerating a lil but the good was that bad.I love steak n have visited chili's n tulare location. There food was delicious n full of flavors. I will return to that location but not the visalia one.N when the manager said that that's how they cook the food I was just fed up n WANTED to go home n eat my own food. Not sorry they need to train cooks better. Not a good visit AT ALL.

HORRIBLE!!!! We sat down, took 20mins to get our drinks, ordered and appetizer, it came out burnt, reordered it then we didn't get it until the rest of our food came out, then I get my food & it has a HUGE hair in it!!! I send it back, reorder, & ended up not getting my food until I was ready to walk out the door!! I did NOT get to eat with my family, & the manager was NO HELP what so ever!!! I will NOT be eating here again!!! Completely Disgusted!!!
Tara was an amazing waitress, place was packed and she still out shined herself!! Definitely the best server and so cute and friendly!!  Dori & Dennis

I will never return to this restaurant again. Time after time after time, I have a horrible experience with this location.  Having moved from a bigger city and having enjoyed Chili's before, this place is terrible. The staff is rude, doesn't listen and have attitudes. One time I came in with my wife and my 2 kids a my niece, we had to find someone to seat us. Then when we were seated, another couple was seated after us. The other couple had their drinks and order taken before anyone ever came to ask us if we needed drinks. (Don't want to say racist, but we are black and Hispanic and they were white.) I placed an order for Pick up, for a party up to 3 weeks in advanced and even double checked a week before and the day before. When I arrived at the time I requested, the staff looked stunned. I was eventually told that they made it yesterday, and they would get on it right away. Needless to say, I wasn't comped anything and I was 1.5 hrs late with people waiting. The last time , wife and I ducked in for a quick bite.  Wasn't very busy. Hostess asks if we wanted Bar or dining room. We said Bar, saw a table we wanted and when we asked if she could clean it, rolled her eyes with an attitude.  Table now cleared, but not wiped. Asked wait staff if they could wipe it off, again attitude.  Finally able to order food, placed order at 5:20, noticed fork had food on it and asked wait staff for a clean one. He returned stating that they were all out and handed me a plastic fork. (REALLY). Food finally arrived at 6:15. As he brought the food I had to ask for a box because we had to go now.  Everyone here needs to be fired and then rehire people who want to work and can be friendly no matter what and make sure the customers are happy.  I'll drive the extra 15 mins to Tulare if I'm going to Chili's. This location is a joke.

My sister and I made an online order at 8:45pm pre-paid. The system stated that my order would be ready at 9:17. I get to the restaurant at 9:25 to give them a little bit of time and because I was running a little late! I walk in, I see 6 employees walking and talking to each other and not one acknowledges me. If it was busy, I would completely understand. However, there were only about 8 guests in the restaurant.. it's now 9:35 and I talk to the bartender and she goes back and tells someone. 5 minutes later a gentlemen comes out, tells me "Well no one told me you were here, your food has been sitting here for TEN MINUTES." So, because this staff did not acknowledge my presence, I had to wait an extra 15-20 minutes for nothing?? It is now 9:45pm and I am barely now receiving my order. ONE HOUR????? I can't believe it. My sister was so excited because she seen the ad on the commercial which is why we ordered here, now that this happened she isn't even excited to eat her food. And I just looked at my container box. You can tell that it says Mike written in pen, and Monica written on over that. That seems that either Mike didn't show up and we had the same order so they gave it to me, or they don't even have the decency to give me a freaking new container box for my food. Thanks Chilis!

I came to this location for the first time with a friend. I really enjoyed it. We came late at night and sat in the bar area. Our waiter was very helpful in helping us choose an alcoholic drink (presidente margarita) and it was great! Our food was amazing. We will be back. No complaints here.
This place has gone down hill. Try calling to place a to go order and it had a busy tone. Been trying for 10 mins calling them but busy tone every time. Don't eat here.

My girlfriend & I love to come here, but lately it's been going downhill. We tried calling to place a to-go order at 3 pm and they never answered it just kept ringing so we thought it might be busy. We tried calling maybe about 4 more times after that, but no answer still. So we said we would try again later, then we try again around 8 and still no one answered for to-go. So I called again but this time instead of to-go I called to speak to the manager. Thankfully he answered and I told him that no one answered to-go and I called about maybe 5 times and his response was that they were fixing the phone operating system. Then I placed my order with him, the manager, and he said it would take about 15 mins. So it took me about 20 mins to get there and I still had to wait an EXTRA 20 mins to get my food!! FUNNY thing is when I got there the phone was ringing off the hooks, working perfectly fine!! Ridiculous! To top it all off the manager didn't even take my order correctly and it was cold. Thanks a lot chillis next time I'll order somewhere else!

Not necessarily a fan of chilis in general but after tonights visit, i totally changed my opinion. The husband chose to eat here for dinner and i reluctantly agreed. We sat in the bar area with self seating and was greeted by the greastest server on the planet "Tara". We started with tableside guacamole, chips and salsa. We devoured it all. For our entrees i chose the chipolte crispers and waffles. Very different but super tasty. My husband got the honey chipolte sirloin and shrimp. I tried a bite of his steak and it was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Tara was hustling like a pro as well so we never waited long for anything. Our water glasses were never empty and she checked in without hovering. Great food and even better prices here. We will come back soon.

We went to dinner at 630 on a Wednesday night. No line. We were greeted and seated by friendly host and without delay we were seated.  The waitress Serena was great. No complaint there. She was very attentive. The food was good and exactly what you expect here.  This restaurant is alway busy and in the past kind slow in the kitchen. I think that has been fixed. We will continue to visit this restaurant. Much faster and better than the nearby Applebee's.

Went to Chili's for lunch today to take advantage of am email exclusive special that I had received. We were seated promptly upon arrival, which is always a plus for me. Our server Tera was over to our table within 2 minutes to take our drink order. Tera returned with our drinks within 2-3 minutes ready to take our food order. While we were waiting for our food order Tera stopped by at least two times to check on us. The food we ordered was great, but it was our server Tera who made the experience enjoyable. It seemed like we never had to ask for anything as Tera seemed to anticipate what we needed. If you add in the good food and excellent service my overall opinion of Chili's has changed to positive.

This was an amazing experience! Came here on my night off with my best friend, a fellow server. We had an amazing time and enjoyed both the food and the service. Cynthia took care of us was always making sure that we had what we needed and delivered our drinks in a timely manner as soon as they were ready at the bar. Our server recommended the buffalo cauliflower appetizer, and it was definitely a favorite of ours , we will be coming back for it next time. Thanks, Cynthia! Cheers!
Got chilis to go and they forgot the extra salsa I specifically asked and paid for AND there was a LONG BLACK HAIR in my mex bowl. Nasty.

We came in with a party of 22 guests for lunch, they were able to move enough tables together for all of us to be seated at one large table, they where super friendly took our orders in a timely manner and delivered our orders at the same time, all awhile making sure we had refills on all of our drinks. We had a great server Jackie along with others, the manager even came over twice and made sure everything was going Great.  The food and drinks was great I didn't hear anyone complaining about anything.

Yesterday went in for drinks and dinner with the whole family. 1st i asked for a JACK AND COKE they told me they have been out for a few days ( really a few days ) then i asked for a CROWN AND COKE again they have been out for a few days ( what no crown or jack ) so i got a rum and coke. the the food came out next burnt samon and hard day old rice. not a good time (A FEW DAYS WITH OUT JACK COME ON)

The service today was horrible. My kids food was dropped and it took about 20 mins to get new. Manager came over to comp their plates and that was the last we saw of anyone!!!! I finally got up and asked the manager for some help that the service was horrible today! He said sorry and rushed off for our check! Bad service!!!!

Lunch with daughter. Place was not packed. My food order was all wrong, but it was quickly remedied. Food was good once I got my order corrected-I am a picky eater. Anyway, my beef comes with paying for the meal. Kept waiting for the bill. The auto-pay thingie on our table was dead. I set it on the edge so the waitress could see.  She never noticed. After watching folks come in , eat and leave for awhile she had a doctors appointment, so we walked up front to pay.  Then the waitress noticed us, and asked us for a credit card. Still no bill. Just took the credit card and went back somewhere to pay the bill. Heck, since it was my daughters turn to pay for lunch...for all that I know she bought the entire restaurant a round of drinks! I just found that very odd...who expects to pay a bill that they have not received? Never caught the waitresses name.

I love the chilis nearby in Hanford but this one wasn't great. They made my food wrong, the server was average at best (and was telling us she had been there for a year) we waited an extra 20 minutes for a discount to be taken off because the manager was too busy. And to top it off the server changed the tip amount that I left her to what she felt she deserved. Never returning.

Extremely slow service. Place was filthy. Not only were floors a mess in eating areas, but I walked by the opening to the kitchen and it was filthy. I am celiac and ordered a gluten free meal but due to suspected cross contamination, I ended up quite sick right after leaving. Symptoms were that of getting gluten, I immediately recognized the problem. After seeing the disaster in their kitchen, I can fully believe my meal was cross contaminated. My meal was misplaced somewhere and when the table was served, I didn't have anything. I had to remind them and it took awhile before I was served.

It seems like everytime I go to a Chilis it takes a hostess forever to acknowledge and seat me. Theyre always understaffed. I ordered the Fresh Mex bowl and it did not have a good taste to it. Dissappointed because all the ingredients work well but they either season or sauce it, that makes it awful. On top of that our waitress kept coming to our table saying "what sauce did you want, I totally forgot" "which beer did you order, I totally forgot" well she also forgot to give us refills or check on us for the remainder of the time. I only gave them two stars because I absolutely love the chips and salsa. The thin, crispy chips are just so satisfying. I'll just order those to go next time and skip dining at the resteraunt.
We sat in the lounge & ordered drinks & dinner. The waitress and those that helped her were very attentive.  The Texas ribs had a lot of meat on them and we would definitely order again.

Ok, back in the day (90s) Chili's was good. Their menu is now all over the place as they can't decide if they want to be a Mexican food/Tex-mex or an American diner or country kitchen or . . . Their menu reads as they want to please everyone, sacrificing quality. For this site specifically the hostess pushed us towards open seating in the bar despite the restaurant being fairly empty "I CAN seat you, but if you want the bar is open".  She just stared at us so we went to the bar. Our waitress came and took our order, but was also bartender and lord knows what else because she disappeared for 20 minutes with our drink glasses remaining empty during that time. Food was meh, even for the price. (Seriously Chili's stick to your Tex-Mex). Was only there because someone gave me a $50 gift card. After 45 mins I flagged down our waitress for the bill, gave her the gift card, she came back and had run the wrong table on it. Really I could have walked, our bill was $43, she charged us $26 (think it was the check for the table next to us) and even pointed out i had $24 left by handing me the receipt. At first I was confused but then saw a child's meal was on the ticket (no children here). I had to flag down another waitress after 5 minutes because again ours was MIA. Since it was a gift card she tried to do this weird math trying to correct the error by charging the gift card a particular amount leaving it with $4. I tried pointing out to her (doing math in my head) there should be $7 left. She said no, said she did the math on her phone, pulled it out again to show me, then screwed up again getting a third number. I just told her there should be $7 left and just to take the gift card and keep the rest as a tip. She thanked me for not skipping out. But still. Should not be this complicated.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT, PLEASE FIX THIS ESTABLISHMENT!!!!!!! Here's a little background to my experience today. We had a party of 11 and we were celebrating my brother's 25th birthday. Our waiter was fabulous (his name was Jacob), but it was the manager who completely ruined it for us. We all ordered our food and after about an hour of waiting, the food came out and we were all anxious to eat. Only problem was, there was 2 meals missing. We were then told that our 2 meals "disappeared" from the order and that they were never even prepared. Aggravated, but still holding it together, we said it was okay and that we would wait for the meals. After about 30 minutes, our meals STILL weren't finished. Finally, after exactly 55 minutes, our plates came to our table. They were both wrong. At this point, we ask to speak to a manager. This manager never once asked us about how our experience was going, but asked both tables around us. As soon as he comes over, we explain to him that it's been over 2 hours and we barely received our meals, and they weren't even correct. Our whole table was already finished eating by this time. The manager tells us the same story, that our orders "disappeared" and that it was due to bad WiFi internet connection. He didn't even offer to give us any sort of gratitude for the horrible service. We then demand that something be done. The manager finally realizes that all we wanted to do was have an enjoyable dining experience; which we weren't even close to receiving. The manager, with an angry tone, says that both the last 2 meals would be removed from the ticket. This was a sigh of relief, but not the end. It took almost another HOUR for them to sort our tickets correctly. The manager, who coincidentally stayed on the other side of the restaurant after our verbal altercation, was seen watching his waiters try to figure out our incorrect tickets. The manager didn't offer any sort of help to his poor waiters, and in the end, made the task that much more difficult. All he had to do was what any ethical manager would do, handle the situation. Instead, he never once came back to us asking if the problem had been corrected. Finally, the tickets were properly split up and we paid them all. Again, I want to let all of you know that our waiter was AMAZING, and he did everything that he could for us. It was the manager who should've taken care of us after the problem persisted. If you've read this far, then you understand why my family and I will never be coming to this restaurant (which we all once loved and enjoyed) again. I don't recommend anybody come here unless they want a horrible experience.

Came here on a Saturday evening (after Black Friday) and surprisingly it wasn't crazy busy! *This restaurant is located in a nice location too, right on Mooney in the Target shopping center. Inside the restaurant, the booths happened to be occupied but bar tables were open. *Self seating in the bar area. Atmosphere is casual but good to bring friends or family because of the moderate noise level. The service was pretty decent. Our waitress checked in regularly, was polite, and didn't forget anything which is always nice. The food was all pretty tasty, I love the southwestern eggrolls so that was why we chose to eat here. I guess it's been a while since I've been to a Chilis because it seemed like the menu was revamped a bit and lots of new items added. I tried a menu item I hadn't tried before (the chicken and waffles,) and surprisingly it was really good! I couldn't eat many of them because they're filling and taste rich but I would probably order them again as well. Another good menu item here is the chicken fajitas. We sent ours back because we like the chicken "more grilled" but it wasn't a problem and the waitress corrected it. Last, my favorite dessert here is the chocolate molten cake, the chocolate is really good especially on the inside! Overall it was a good experience and I would recommend this location.

The food was terrible! We asked the waitress for the chips & salsa that we remembered were served. The waitress brought them out & was missing for most of the visit. When the check came I asked why I was being charged for chips, it was then that she let me know they are no longer complementary & there was nothing she could do even though she did not mention it was an appetizer & NOT complimentary. I asked to speak to the manager, after a little back & forth he said he'd give me a discount, he was rude & seemed reluctant to help me out, & before I could even finish saying "I appreciate your assistance" he left mid sentence without even saying "have a good night" or anything like that. Also I didn't understand why he was so rude when all he gave me was a $1 discount. Lost several customers for $1! Buffalo Wild Wings is right next door, GO THERE! Or Applebee's a block away!
Great service! Good Food!.. I recommend you come in try the Smoke House combo! I had a really good experience here and I am definitely coming back to this place. Seating wasn't the best.
Always a great place to stop for some grub. It's always clean the noise is fairly low.  My quesadilla is delish plus my waitresses Maryann is fabulous...

I love chili's their food is allllways delicious and plated nicely. Went there today with our family and the server was incredibly slow and was inattentive, no refills on our drinks til last minute she was hardly checking on us. I prefer an " annoying server" that's always asking if we need anything. Also she didn't have a name tag on or even introduce herself to us. Super awkward server experience. But if you ever go into chilis request Nicole if shes working shes great!

Stopped in for dessert. I saw they have a new caramel cake so asked if they could put caramel on the chocolate plus add extra scoop of ice cream. Courtney was so so sweet! She made a beautiful creation exactly like I asked for. We are very delighted and happy with our dessert experience.

I am not sure why this Chili's location has such a low rating. When we came for lunch. The restaurant was clean, the staff was friendly, our waitress was friendly and attentive, the quality of the food was above average, and the price was great.  We went for the two for $22, great selection of meals and yes the price went up from their previous two for $20 but thanks for the California voters who voted to raise minimum wage well what did we expect was going to happen? Overall great experience and we will be back

Ate here on Christmas Eve. We were seated as soon as they could setup a table for our group, 5 adults and 5 children (all 4 and under). Crazy right? Our server was fairly new, within 2 months. She did an outstanding job. She watched our table to be sure the little ones had drinks and the food came out fast. I am gluten free. The staff always knows what to do. They make sure my order is handled properly. The Ribs and Smashed potatoes are fantastic.   It was a great meal and great service as always.
